column4: I've got an HP LaserJet 4000 and when printing a test page with the suggested postscript driver nothing comes out but goobldygook.  Any ideas?
What's the exact driver name you're using?
the driver just says "Postscript (recommended) (Suggested)"
Ok
The other choices are hpijs, lj5gray, and pxlmono.
If you change to hpijs does it work?
Haven't tried yet as I would prefer Postscript and the odd name of the hpijs driver spooked me a bit.
Well, it's dumping invalid postscript to the printer (hence the garbage)
That's what I figured as well.  I was hoping this was a known issue with a known workaround.
Is the printer locally connected (parallel or usb), or is it on a network
Local via Parallel.
The hpijs driver prints garbage as well.
Mmmm
What's the parallel port using?
(ECP, etc.)
Using?  Ah.
How do I find out from within Ubuntu?  I don't see a parallel port in the device manager.
Aside from the bios I'm not sure (the dev manager in breezy shows ECP on my box)
Hmm...
I don't see the parallel port in the Hoary device manager.
You have yours set to ECP, correct?  I can at least verify that mine's set the same.
Not to throw a towel on the conversation but everything's printing fine from WinXP.
